result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant William L Massey IV was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Maintain full time work, school, or combination of the two and provide proof at least 30 days prior to the expiration of this Agreement. Complete high school or obtain a GED/HSED.

Commit no further law violations during the period of this agreement. Have no contact with FB, his residence or place of employment. Defendant understands that "no contact" means no direct or indirect contact, whether in person, by phone, or by mail, and whether initiated by the defendant or by someone on the defendant's behalf. The only exceptions to this condition will be for contact as required by any mediation agreement, counseling, or a letter of apology required by this DAGPA. Consume no alcohol beverages or controlled substances. No entry into bars or taverns, however, the defendant may engage in employment in restaurants whose primary purpose if the serving of food. Not to possess drug paraphernalia.

Take any/all medicines prescribed to the defendant by a licensed physician. Successfully complete Alternatives to Violence (ATV), Anger Management, or other approved course of counseling. Written documentation of the defendant's attendance and compliance with all individual and group requirements must be sent by the defendant to the District Attorney's office on or before October 1, 2018. Defendant shall comply with any and all rules of probation and successfully complete any term of probation ordered as part of this case (two years). Defendant shall provide a copy of this agreement, along with the Criminal Complaint, to any counselor and sign any and all releases necessary to allow the counselor (or agency) to report compliance or lack thereof to the District Attorney's Office. Any assessments done without this agreement and the Criminal Complaint(s) being supplied to the counselor will be considered violations of this agreement and not be accepted. This agreement may be revoked or the defendant may have to complete a new assessment.

Complete an Alcohol and/or Other Drug Abuse (AODA) Assessment with a certified Alcohol and Drug Abuse Counselor, at an appropriate counseling or treatment center and willingly cooperate in any recommended counseling or treatment. The defendant must ensure that the counselor sends the written results of said assessment to the District Attorney's Office on or before 6/1/17. If counseling is recommended, the defendant must ensure that the counselor sends written documentation of the defendant's attendance and compliance with any recommendation to the District Attorney's Office by 10/1/18.

Defendant shall pay restitution, as part of this DAGPA, in the amount of $3,817. This payment shall be made to the District Attorney's office in form or cash or money order (no personal check will be accepted) on behalf of the victim. Restitution in the amount of $1000 shall be paid prior to court on 4/7/17. The remaining $2,817 shall be paid on or before 6/30/17. The remaining restitution of $10,527.19 plus 10% DA surcharge of $1,734.19 shall be paid in full through probation.

Pay $250 fine plus costs. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Pay restitution as shown on Door County Restitution Summary, plus statutorily authorized surcharges. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Maintain full time employment and/or school.

Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol. Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed. Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia. No contact direct or indirect with victim or his family. Not to enter bars or taverns unless he works there and the primary purpose of the business is food service.
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.
Obtain AODA assessment and comply with treatment recommendations.

timeConds.notes: Stayed, to be used at discretion of Court through petition by Dept. of Corrections.
Perform 50 hours of uncompensated community service for non-profit agency or organization.

miscConds.notes: Pay costs of the action. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

records.addlTxt: Door County Restitution Summary
Deferred Acceptance of Guilty Plea Agreement
1 - Photographs

Defendant William L Massey in court with attorney Brett E Reetz. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State advises of plea agreement, conditions contained within DAGPA, including details regarding amounts due, presents argument regarding sentencing. Atty Reetz presents sentencing argument. Defendant makes statement. Victim makes statement (exhibit 1 - photographs). Victim's father (appearing by phone) makes statement. Court makes statement, accepts DAGPA.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for March 25, 2019 at 09:30 am.

Defendant William L Massey in court with attorney Brett E Reetz. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Counsel advise of proposed plea agreement. Court questions basis for Alford plea. Defense/State makes statements. State will file Amended Information first thing Monday morning. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, elements. Defendant enters Alford plea plea to Counts 1, 3, 4. Court questions Defendant on rights, finds pleas made freely and voluntarily, accepts pleas on Counts 3, 4, and finds Defendant guilty of Counts 3, 4. Court withholds acceptance of plea on Count 1. Count 2 is dismissed but read in for sentencing. Bond continues as is.
by State

Defendant William L Massey in court with attorney Brett E Reetz. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court questions status. Defense advises of phone call with expert witness, requests another pre-trial, advises of additional settlement negotiations.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 17, 2017 at 03:30 pm.
from VW Coordinator Mraz objecting to Defense's request for continuance
from Defense to Court requesting continuance of trial date

Defendant William L Massey in court with attorney Brett E Reetz. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews letter from Defense received today requesting rescheduling, letter from VW Coordinator objecting to rescheduling. Court reviews history of case. State presents argument against rescheduling. Defense presents argument. State presents further argument. Court questions Defense on why request was not made sooner. Defense responds. Court is not inclined to reschedule case yet, would like to hear more regarding Defendant's expert. Further discussion, including whether Defendant's expert can appear by phone/video.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 13, 2017 at 11:15 am.
and verdict forms from Defendant
for Substitution of Attorney

Pre-trial conference on February 23, 2017 at 01:30 pm.
from Defense advising of Defendant's employment

Defendant William L Massey in court with attorney Sarah Sonia Malcore. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews previous activity. Defense advises of offer from State that requires substantial restitution payment, has paid $3000 but had not been able to come up with additional $2500 to avoid felony conviction, requests additional month.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 9, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant called to advise of new employer.

Defendant William L Massey in court with attorney Sarah Sonia Malcore. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Originally set for plea hearing. Defense advises that they are not prepared to proceed to plea, advises of negotiations that are ongoing, advises of restitution amount and Defendant's attempts to raise additional up-front restitution payment. State advises of latest restitution request from victim, advises how restitution will be disbursed. Bond continues as is.  Status conference scheduled for October 13, 2016 at 02:15 pm.
from Defense requesting rescheduling

Defendant William L Massey in court with attorney Sarah Sonia Malcore. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews previous activity, questions status. State advises of e-mail received regarding payment of restitution up front, has not had a chance to discuss that with victim and his family.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 26, 2016 at 03:45 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for William L Massey IV

Defendant William L Massey in court with attorney Sarah Sonia Malcore. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises that case is not resolved, advises of hope to make up front restitution payment of $4,000 ($3,000 of which Defendant has already paid), advises that Defendant is trying to get additional/more gainful employment, is living with a parent in Illinois, may be relocating. Defense requests 60 day continuance. State advises that case is approaching 1 year anniversary, restitution is around $15,000, no payments have been made toward that yet. Court makes statement, will be expecting plea and potentially sentencing. Court makes statement to victim about possibility of order for PSI.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 12, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant William L Massey in court with attorney Sarah Sonia Malcore. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense was provided discovery from Atty Reetz's office this week, needs additional time to meet with Defendant, requests 45-60 days. Bond continues as is.  Status conference scheduled for June 23, 2016 at 10:30 am.
by Defendant

Court questions Defendant, who agrees with withdrawal, will be seeking PD representation. Court grants withdrawal. Defendant leaves to see PD.

No contact direct or indirect with FB or his residence at 12010 STH 42, Ellison Bay. To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving Justice Center.

State gives incident report, potential charges. Court questions Defendant on address/employment history, reviews right to Counsel. Court finds probable cause, sets bond. Return 9/21/15, 10:00.
